snippet: Under Marine Le Pen, the National Front has softened its xenophobic image to better seize on economic insecurity and anti-immigrant sentiment.
abstract: Marine Le Pen, charismatic and complicated leader of France's far-right National Front party, has moderated party's image and is moving it from fringes of politics to center; rise of National Front, which won 11 cities and towns in French mayoral elections, is driven by public's fear of economic insecurity, anti-immigrant and anti-Muslim sentiment and disgust with political establishment.
lead_paragraph: Under Marine Le Pen, the National Front has softened its xenophobic image to better seize on economic insecurity and anti-immigrant sentiment.

headline.main: National Front Wins Support and Elections
headline.print_headline: Moderation Pays Off for Far-Right French Party
